author: Admin
title: Rosemary D. Oglesby-Henry Promotes Her Novel – The Rose Who Blossomed Through the Concrete
text:
Trilogy Christian Publishing is pleased to introduce The Rose Who Blossomed Through the Concrete: Consequence Vs Choice by Rosemary D. Oglesby-Henry, a compelling and spiritually enriching Christian women’s fiction novel. This thought-provoking book, now available for readers worldwide, invites individuals to explore the transformative power of faith and personal choices.
In The Rose Who Blossomed Through the Concrete, Rosemary D. Oglesby-Henry shares a heartfelt narrative of her own life journey, portraying the struggles and obstacles she faced as she navigated the challenges of teenage parenthood and life’s adversities. This poignant story unveils the author’s spiritual awakening, demonstrating that one can find strength, healing, and purpose even in the midst of adversity.
In her own words, Rosemary says, “Oblivious and unconcerned with what was happening, I allowed the pitfalls of life to form in what I thought was a perfect garden. I learned that you cannot mend a spiritual wound with human tools. Thus, God left my garden covered by concrete.”
The Rose Who Blossomed Through the Concrete calls on girls, women, and mothers to transform their faltering faith into a source of spiritual growth and healing. Rosemary’s testimony serves as an inspirational beacon, encouraging each reader to view their choices and their consequences as opportunities to draw closer to God, uncover their life’s purpose, and ultimately flourish.
About the Author:
Rosemary D. Oglesby-Henry is a native Cincinnatian whose remarkable life journey has fueled her passion for helping others. As a teen parent, Rosemary faced numerous challenges, but her unwavering faith in God, her strong support network, and her self-motivation propelled her toward personal healing and a deep desire to assist others on their own journeys. She is a nationally recognized leadership educator, accomplished author, philanthropist, and the CEO of a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering teen parents through self-leadership development. Rosemary’s work has garnered recognition in Forbes and other notable publications, and she has been featured in the documentary Worth One’s Salt, which explores health equity issues in maternal health for black pregnant teens.
Rosemary has received over 40 honors and accolades for her leadership and philanthropic efforts throughout her illustrious career. She is a sought-after speaker, panelist, and advocate for youth pregnancy awareness, education, and maternal health. Additionally, Rosemary’s business acumen has allowed her to mentor and consult with over 50 small businesses and non-profits, contributing to significant revenue growth.
For more information about
Rosemary D. Oglesby-Henry and her work, please visit her website at https://www.thepetalsincorporation.com/ The Rose Who Blossomed Through the Concrete: Consequence Vs Choice is available for purchase on Amazon at https://www.amazon.com/Rose-Who-Blossomed-Through-Concrete-ebook/dp/B0BJN6GQKZ/
